page.title: 19TYNESIDE COMMERCIAL PARK
page.content: Here the{MetroCentre}with its large stores and car parks in a landscaped area, will occupy a 115 acre site between the{Western Bypass}and the R. Tyne west of Dunston. Since it lies within the{Enterprise Zone}there are considerable advantages to be enjoyed here-exemption from rates,capital allowances for the cost of development and simplified planning permission. Excavations of the site once occupied by the ash disposal site for Dunston power Station began in 1984 and it is hoped that the{first of the stores {will be open by 1987 .}Although not all of the information concerning the nature of the premises has as yet been released .It is expected to draw its customers from the whole of the Tyne and Wear area. Firms such as Marks & Spencer and Carrefours have begun construction of large new stores.
